New Records: DL Hall worked seven scoreless innings, the best start of his career for the Brewers.
The Brewers scored 10 runs in the 9th inning, their highest run tally in a single inning this season.
Key Match Events: The Brewers scored 10 runs in the bottom of the 9th inning to secure the victory.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers' manager expressed relief after the dominant performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the second game of a doubleheader.
The Brewers swept the Reds in the doubleheader, winning both games.
Others: The Brewers' win extended their lead in the NL Central division.
The game was played at Great American Ball Park in Cincinnati with an attendance of 22,488.Betting odds and win probability were listed but did not directly impact the game outcome.
